alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Southeast Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bristol, east central Providence and Bristol Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Swansea, or near Bristol. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Torrential downpours could lead to localized minor street flooding. Locations impacted include... Fall River, Taunton, East Providence, Bristol, Somerset, Barrington, Swansea, Seekonk, Rehoboth, Warren, Freetown, Dighton and Berkley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
